author: Special Correspondent
text:
Bharathi Park area residents have launched an online signature campaign, appealing to Coimbatore Corporation to shift the waste segregation hub from Bharathi Park to another area.

According to Jayachandran, a resident of Saibaba Colony, since the launch of the campaign on Saturday, 70 people have signed the petition.

It is available on change.org and is also circulated on social media

“We have submitted petitions to the Corporation officials earlier. Garbage collection vehicles are parked at the park and the segregation hub is also located there. The residents are affected by odour because of dumping of waste at the segregation hub, especially those in the nearby streets,” he alleged.
title: ‘Save Bharathi Park’ campaign launched in Coimbatore
